org.jtrim.swing.component

Interface AsyncRenderingComponent.PaintHook<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the object returned by ImageRenderer passed to the setRenderingArgs method
    Enclosing class:
    AsyncRenderingComponent

    public static interface AsyncRenderingComponent.PaintHook<T>
    Instances of this interface can be passed to the setRenderingArgs method and the methods of this interface will be called prior to and after rendering.

    Methods of this interface are expected to be called from within the paintComponent2D method and therefore can expect to be called from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void postPaintComponent(RenderingState state, T renderingResult, java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Called after the result of asynchronous painting has been copied to the Graphics2D object to be displayed.
      boolean prePaintComponent(RenderingState state, java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      This method is called before actually painting the AsyncRenderingComponent and may draw to the Graphics2D prior rendering.

    • Method Detail

      • prePaintComponent

        boolean prePaintComponent(RenderingState state,
                        java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        This method is called before actually painting the AsyncRenderingComponent and may draw to the Graphics2D prior rendering.

        Note that since this method is called from the EDT, it should not do any expensive painting operation. Also note that every invocation of the paintComponent2D method will call this method.

        Parameters:
        state - the RenderingState associated with the rendering process whose result is to be painted to the AsyncRenderingComponent. This argument cannot be null.
        g - the Graphics2D object to which this method may draw to prior the rendered data being copied to this Graphics2D object. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if the result of the asynchronous rendering operation need to be copied to the Graphics2D object, false otherwise. That is, if this method returns false, the result of the asynchronous rendering will be ignored, not even postPaintComponent will be called.

      • postPaintComponent

        void postPaintComponent(RenderingState state,
                      T renderingResult,
                      java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Called after the result of asynchronous painting has been copied to the Graphics2D object to be displayed. This method has a last chance to render something on the Graphics2D to be displayed. That is, anything this method draws on the passed Graphics2D will be visible to the user and will not be overwritten.

        Note that since this method is called from the EDT, it should not do any expensive painting operation. Also note that every invocation of the paintComponent2D method will call this method if the previous prePaintComponent method returned true and the asynchronous rendering operation has completed at least once.

        Parameters:
        state - the RenderingState associated with the rendering process whose result is to be painted to the AsyncRenderingComponent. This argument cannot be null.
        renderingResult - the last object returned by an asynchronous rendering (via the ImageRenderer). This argument can be null if the asynchronous rendering operation has returned a null result.
        g - the Graphics2D object to which this method may draw something. This argument cannot be null.
